metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3910 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google V8 before 4.3.61.21, as used in Google Chrome before 43.0.2357.65, allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179
chromium-browser-l10n - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179
chromium-chromedriver - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.7.8-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.7.8-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.7.8-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.7.8-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.7.8-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.8-0ubuntu1').
